text: Yes, thank you <@U03UY195LKD>. Do you have any personal experience with getting rejected a theme for this specific reason?
Not yet <@U01U201MTQF>
Flexible method is old way, DND Area is a the new improved version for drag and drop system on page editor itself which use dnd modules in row containers.
It is true that DND Area is the new version, but I wouldn’t say its the improved one. Both have their pros and cons. That’s why I asked here to see if there is a workaround on this biased requirement
You're right. But they have set requirements to submit a theme. You can further ask marketplace team directly with your feedback.

Check this line out from the official guide <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas|Drag and Drop Areas>
“… Because they’re so flexible and useful it is a _*good idea*_ to have at least 1 template in your theme include drag and drop areas. …”

It says it’s a “Good Idea”, so I’ll be submitting my form as is, and then let you know how it goes.
As far as contacting the Marketplace Team, I think they are on this Channel already!
Great, you can.

#3 in the marketplace theme requirements MP referenced is "Themes must be built using HTML + HubL Templates (coded files) *and dnd_area (Drag and Drop Areas) tags*" . The Drag and Drop Areas documentation you referenced is just talking about using DnD for your own personal use, not in the marketplace.
<@U39DT5YFL> good point. I guess I'll roll up my sleeves and get to it then :smiling_face_with_tear:

<@U01U201MTQF> You dont have to make your module "dnd-abble". Our theme is also build with full width modules.  The templates just need to be build with dnd_area. But you can just include the modules like so
This message was deleted.
umm
can you share your code related to how the header font is implemented?
nope — I mean inside your header module — or the css file
```font-family: {{ theme.header.header_font.font }}}```
that has three } likely needs an `;`
but you also need to use the other font properties inside the css file so they are picked up
because right now it is only changing the font family
Oh I think I'm following. That would make sense. I will try it and see if I get it to render. Thank you for your help, new to this as you can see.
its okay, we were all new at some point!
```{{ theme.header.header_font.size }}```
that might do the size
using dot notation, you can play around with it
and if you ever wonder — how do I do this and you are unsure of syntax, you can do something like

`{{ theme.header|tojson }}`

And that will print out what is accessible
it prints out the object in json format.. works for all HubSpot stuff (ehh maybe it doesn’t work for some very minor things, but overall it should work)
You're amazing! That was exactly what I was missing.. duh. Don't know how I couldn't connect the dots there. Thanks again! You rock.
new stuff can be intimidating and we aren’t always thinking solidly — glad you got it going!

Yeah so the only thing I can't figure out is still that dang font size.. I called out this via CSS:
```header p {font-size: {{ theme.header.header_font.size }}; }```
and it's giving it a default value of 16px which is what I want but it's not allowing me to actually update it..
This is great news, thank you <@UATE4ATHP> :beers:
After changing it are you saving it and then refreshing?

hmm yes I am.. it looks like it's rendering but a p tag is overruling it somewhere
so

there is your thingy doer ---

rich text is going to allow whatever html is in there to overrirde, so putting a <p> wrapper around there will either cause invalid html or negate it
anytime I’m using a rich text I would go like this
that's what I was thinking too that would be causing that. That would make sense on why it's getting overridden. Let me see if changing it your way works for sure! again, thank you for chiming in.

and then force whatever item I want

you have a preview link?

ugh you are workign on this
you don’t have any css targeting the header__content <https://share.getcloudapp.com/YEuWZ97d>
I would need additional CSS to target the .header__content class for it to render?
```{{ theme.header.header_font.size }}```
if you want the div to have that, then you gotta do that the the part that it inherits

```header .header__content { font-size: {{ heme.header.header_font.size  }}; }
header .header__content * { font-size: inherit; }```
the first one says put this font size here
the second one with the * says inherit the font size from the parent
Okay so this is what i've got:
Still not seeing it pull through :disappointed:
theme*
it says heme
line 6
ALSO, Get used to using preview links.. inside the page editor, preview in new window — this will add a ?hs_preview… to the end of the url, that fixes the cache 99% of the time
Dang even with that fix.. nothing. Not sure what else I'm doing wrong. I've cleared cache
Again this is what i've got:
html:
PX
you need that other theme variable
lol sorry
got it, let me add
```size_unit```
`{{ theme.header.header_font.size_unit }}`
this time I put the t in there :upside_down_face:

I've seen it done this way before too:
```font-size: {{ theme.header.header_font.size ~ theme.header.header_font.size_unit }}```
would that work? I just tried it but still not rendering
so maybe the "~" doesn't work
```font-size: {{ theme.header.header_font.size }}{{ theme.header.header_font.size_unit }};```
apologies, I don’t mess with font sizes and what not in themes
your fine! just glad someone is willing to help!
